## Government Tender Announcement

**Issued by:** Public Works and Government Services Canada

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01003385
**Solicitation Number:** EN578-20ISC3
**Publication Date:** August 25, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** November 3, 2022 (14:00 EST)

**Description:**

Public Works and Government Services Canada invites proposals from innovative companies to develop a Visual AI system for Space Robotics Obstacle Detection. The successful candidate will develop a system that uses Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques to detect obstacles in real-time and verify clearance margins in dynamic and uncertain environments.

**Objectives:**

* Develop a real-time vision system that can operate in space environment under all solar lighting conditions
* Use 2D camera data from existing cameras built into a space manipulator or mounted to its infrastructure
* Detect slender objects (2 cm wide) such as cable harnesses and EVA tethers with high accuracy
* Provide obstacle detection along the entire length of a space robotic arm and about any attached or manipulated payloads
* Operate on a typical space platform with limited resources (CPU, memory, power, and data bandwidth)

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* Solution must operate in real-time and use existing cameras
* Solution must detect slender objects with high accuracy and provide obstacle detection along the entire length of a space robotic arm
* Solution must operate on a typical space platform with limited resources
* Solution must provide a 3D virtual world display of the manipulator and any obstacles detected
* Solution should have robust performance with respect to distorted and blurred images

**Additional Requirements:**

* Solution should incur minimum budget increase to power, mass, volume, and computation resources
* Solution should investigate the feasibility of adding path-to-flight computing hardware to the onboard avionics
* Solution should detect features inside of a given clearance volume or a keep out zone
* Solution should use a vision algorithm requiring a minimum number of independent camera views

**Submission Instructions:**

To prepare a bid, carefully review this challenge and the Call for Proposals. Propose your solution in the specified format and ensure it meets all the requirements outlined in this challenge.

**Enquiries:**

All enquiries should be submitted in writing to TPSGC.SIC-ISC.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca at least 10 calendar days before the Challenge Notice closing date. Late enquiries may not be answered.
